data.name: Tip_Content_Placeholder
data.value: Text of the tip would appear here. Zombie ipsum reversus ab viral inferno, nam rick grimes malum cerebro. De carne lumbering animata corpora quaeritis. Summus brains sit​​, morbo vel maleficia? De apocalypsi gorger omero undead survivor dictum mauris.
data.comment: Placeholder content for tips during database initialization

data.name: LunarPhase_NewMoon_Description
data.value: New Moon - ideal for deep sky photography, moon not visible
data.comment: Description for New Moon phase and photography recommendations

data.name: LunarPhase_WaxingCrescent_Description
data.value: Waxing Crescent - excellent for terminator detail and earthshine photography
data.comment: Description for Waxing Crescent phase and photography recommendations

data.name: LunarPhase_FirstQuarter_Description
data.value: First Quarter - perfect for crater photography along terminator line
data.comment: Description for First Quarter phase and photography recommendations

data.name: LunarPhase_WaxingGibbous_Description
data.value: Waxing Gibbous - good for mare detail and mountain range photography
data.comment: Description for Waxing Gibbous phase and photography recommendations

data.name: LunarPhase_FullMoon_Description
data.value: Full Moon - best for lunar landscapes and overall surface detail
data.comment: Description for Full Moon phase and photography recommendations

data.name: LunarPhase_WaningGibbous_Description
data.value: Waning Gibbous - excellent for eastern limb features and libration photography
data.comment: Description for Waning Gibbous phase and photography recommendations

data.name: LunarPhase_ThirdQuarter_Description
data.value: Third Quarter - ideal for western crater detail and terminator photography
data.comment: Description for Third Quarter phase and photography recommendations

data.name: LunarPhase_WaningCrescent_Description
data.value: Waning Crescent - perfect for sunrise terminator and earthshine
data.comment: Description for Waning Crescent phase and photography recommendations

data.comment: Description for New Moon phase focusing on dark sky conditions

data.value: Phase: {0}. Best photographed during crescent phases.

data.name: PlanetNotes_Mars
data.value: Best during opposition when closest to Earth.
data.comment: Photography notes for Mars

data.name: PlanetNotes_Jupiter
data.value: Capture the Great Red Spot and Galilean moons.
data.comment: Photography notes for Jupiter

data.name: PlanetNotes_Saturn

data.comment: Photography notes for Saturn

data.name: PlanetNotes_Default

data.name: DeepSkyObjectType_Galaxy
data.comment: Deep sky object type name

data.name: DeepSkyObjectType_Nebula
data.comment: Deep sky object type name

data.name: DeepSkyObjectType_GlobularCluster
data.comment: Deep sky object type name

data.name: DeepSkyObjectType_PlanetaryNebula
data.comment: Deep sky object type name

data.name: DeepSkyEquipment_Galaxy_Faint
data.value: Telescope 200mm+ focal length, dark sky location essential
data.comment: Equipment recommendation for faint galaxies

data.name: DeepSkyEquipment_Galaxy_Bright
data.value: 135-200mm telephoto lens sufficient, moderate light pollution acceptable
data.comment: Equipment recommendation for bright galaxies

data.name: DeepSkyEquipment_Nebula_Large
data.value: Wide-angle lens 14-50mm for full frame capture
data.comment: Equipment recommendation for large nebulae

data.name: DeepSkyEquipment_Nebula_Standard
data.value: Telephoto lens 85-200mm for detail, consider H-alpha filter
data.comment: Equipment recommendation for standard nebulae

data.name: DeepSkyEquipment_GlobularCluster
data.value: 200mm+ telephoto lens, resolve individual stars with longer focal lengths
data.comment: Equipment recommendation for globular clusters

data.name: DeepSkyEquipment_PlanetaryNebula
data.value: Telescope 300mm+ focal length, OIII filter recommended
data.comment: Equipment recommendation for planetary nebulae

data.name: DeepSkyEquipment_Default
data.comment: Default equipment recommendation for deep sky objects

data.name: DeepSkyExposure_Galaxy
data.value: ISO 1600-6400, f/2.8-4, 2-5 minute exposures with tracking
data.comment: Exposure guidance for galaxy photography

data.name: DeepSkyExposure_Nebula
data.value: ISO 800-3200, f/2.8-4, 3-8 minute exposures, consider narrowband filters
data.comment: Exposure guidance for nebula photography

data.name: DeepSkyExposure_GlobularCluster
data.comment: Exposure guidance for globular cluster photography

data.name: DeepSkyExposure_PlanetaryNebula
data.value: ISO 800-1600, f/4-5.6, 2-5 minute exposures with OIII filter
data.comment: Exposure guidance for planetary nebula photography

data.name: DeepSkyExposure_Default
data.value: ISO 800-3200, f/2.8-4, 2-5 minute exposures with star tracker
data.comment: Default exposure guidance for deep sky objects

data.name: ConstellationNotes_Orion
data.value: Winter constellation, excellent for nebula photography. M42 Orion Nebula is ideal beginner target. Use 85-200mm lens for detail.
data.comment: Photography notes for Orion constellation

data.name: ConstellationNotes_Andromeda
data.value: Autumn constellation featuring M31 Andromeda Galaxy. Use 135-200mm lens. Galaxy spans 3+ degrees, plan wide compositions.
data.comment: Photography notes for Andromeda constellation

data.name: ConstellationNotes_Sagittarius
data.value: Summer constellation in Milky Way core region. Rich nebula fields, excellent for wide-field astrophotography. Dark skies essential.
data.comment: Photography notes for Sagittarius constellation

data.name: ConstellationNotes_Cygnus
data.value: Summer constellation along Milky Way. North America Nebula excellent widefield target. Veil Nebula complex requires H-alpha filter.
data.comment: Photography notes for Cygnus constellation

data.name: ConstellationNotes_Cassiopeia
data.value: Circumpolar constellation, visible year-round from northern latitudes. Heart and Soul nebulae excellent autumn targets.
data.comment: Photography notes for Cassiopeia constellation

data.name: ConstellationNotes_UrsaMajor
data.value: Spring constellation featuring the Big Dipper asterism. M81 and M82 galaxy pair excellent telescopic targets.
data.comment: Photography notes for Ursa Major constellation

data.name: ConstellationNotes_Leo
data.value: Spring constellation with Leo Triplet galaxy group. M65, M66, and NGC 3628 form beautiful wide-field composition.
data.comment: Photography notes for Leo constellation

data.name: ConstellationNotes_Scorpius
data.value: Summer constellation with colorful star Antares. Rich Milky Way fields with numerous star clusters and nebulae.
data.comment: Photography notes for Scorpius constellation

data.name: ConstellationNotes_Perseus
data.value: Autumn constellation in rich Milky Way region. Double Cluster and California Nebula excellent wide-field targets.
data.comment: Photography notes for Perseus constellation

data.name: ConstellationNotes_Auriga
data.value: Winter constellation with bright star Capella. IC 405 Flaming Star Nebula and IC 410 Tadpole Nebula are highlights.
data.comment: Photography notes for Auriga constellation

data.name: ConstellationNotes_Default
data.value: Use wide-angle lens for constellation patterns, telephoto for deep sky objects within constellation boundaries.
data.comment: Default photography notes for constellations

data.name: OppositionConditions_Mars_Excellent
data.value: Excellent opposition! Mars appears largest and shows surface features clearly. Look for polar ice caps and dust storms.
data.comment: Mars opposition conditions when very close

data.name: OppositionConditions_Mars_Good
data.value: Good opposition with Mars showing clear surface detail. Polar regions and major dark features visible.
data.comment: Mars opposition conditions when moderately close

data.name: OppositionConditions_Mars_Standard
data.value: Standard Mars opposition. Surface features visible with steady seeing. Best time for Mars photography.
data.comment: Standard Mars opposition conditions

data.name: OppositionConditions_Jupiter
data.value: Excellent conditions for moon photography. All four Galilean moons visible. Great Red Spot rotates every ~10 hours - plan timing for best views.
data.comment: Jupiter opposition viewing conditions

data.name: OppositionConditions_Saturn
data.value: Ring system fully illuminated and widest apparent size. Titan and other major moons easily visible. Cassini Division in rings may be detectable.
data.comment: Saturn opposition viewing conditions

data.name: OppositionConditions_Uranus
data.value: Reaches magnitude ~5.7, barely visible to naked eye in dark skies. Telescope required for disc visibility. Appears blue-green due to methane atmosphere.
data.comment: Uranus opposition viewing conditions

data.name: OppositionConditions_Neptune
data.value: Magnitude ~7.8, telescope essential. Appears as small blue disc. Triton (largest moon) may be visible with larger instruments.
data.comment: Neptune opposition viewing conditions

data.name: OppositionConditions_Default
data.value: Planet reaches maximum brightness and apparent size during opposition. Best time for detailed photography and observation.
data.comment: Default opposition viewing conditions

data.name: OppositionConditions_DefaultError
data.value: Optimal viewing conditions during opposition - planet closest to Earth.
data.comment: Default error message for opposition conditions

data.name: OppositionEquipment_Mars_Excellent
data.value: Excellent opposition! 200-400mm telephoto sufficient for surface features. Consider telescope with 2000mm+ focal length for detailed imaging.
data.comment: Equipment advice for excellent Mars opposition

data.name: OppositionEquipment_Mars_Standard
data.value: Standard opposition. 400mm+ telephoto lens minimum. Telescope with 1500mm+ focal length recommended for surface detail photography.
data.comment: Equipment advice for standard Mars opposition

data.name: OppositionEquipment_Jupiter
data.value: 200mm+ telephoto shows disc and moons. 600mm+ reveals Great Red Spot. Telescope with 2000mm+ focal length for detailed surface bands and storm systems.
data.comment: Equipment advice for Jupiter opposition

data.name: OppositionEquipment_Saturn
data.value: 300mm+ telephoto shows rings. 600mm+ resolves ring gap. Telescope with 2500mm+ focal length required for ring divisions and moon details.
data.comment: Equipment advice for Saturn opposition

data.name: OppositionEquipment_Uranus
data.value: Telescope with 1000mm+ focal length minimum. 2000mm+ shows small disc. Very challenging target requiring excellent atmospheric conditions.
data.comment: Equipment advice for Uranus opposition

data.name: OppositionEquipment_Neptune
data.value: Large telescope essential - 2000mm+ focal length minimum. 3000mm+ preferred. Requires excellent seeing conditions and precise tracking.
data.comment: Equipment advice for Neptune opposition

data.name: OppositionEquipment_Default
data.value: Telescope or long telephoto lens recommended for planetary detail during opposition.
data.comment: Default equipment advice for planetary oppositions

data.name: OppositionEquipment_DefaultError
data.value: Use longest focal length available for maximum planetary detail.
data.comment: Default error message for opposition equipment advice

data.name: Visibility_Unknown
data.comment: Default error message for unknown visibility
